1    | /*****
2    |  ** ** Module Header ******************************************************* **
3    |  ** 									     **
4    |  **   Modules Revision 3.0						     **
5    |  **   Providing a flexible user environment				     **
6    |  ** 									     **
7    |  **   File:		cmdInfo.c					     **
8    |  **   First Edition:	1991/10/23					     **
9    |  ** 									     **
10   |  **   Authors:	John Furlan, jlf@behere.com				     **
11   |  **		Jens Hamisch, jens@Strawberry.COM			     **
12   |  **		R.K. Owen, <rk@owen.sj.ca.us> or <rkowen@nersc.gov>	     **
13   |  ** 									     **
14   |  **   Description:	The Tcl module-info routine which provides informa-  **
15   |  **			tion about the state of Modules as the modulefile    **
16   |  **			is being parsed. 				     **
17   |  ** 									     **
18   |  **   Exports:		cmdModuleInfo					     **
19   |  ** 									     **
20   |  **   Notes:								     **
21   |  ** 									     **
22   |  ** ************************************************************************ **
23   |  ****/
24   | 
25   | /** ** Copyright *********************************************************** **
26   |  ** 									     **
27   |  ** Copyright 1991-1994 by John L. Furlan.                      	     **
28   |  ** see LICENSE.GPL, which must be provided, for details		     **
29   |  ** 									     ** 
30   |  ** ************************************************************************ **/
31   | 
32   | static char Id[] = "@(#)$Id: cmdInfo.c.src.html,v 1.8 2009/09/01 20:22:32 rkowen Exp $";
33   | static void *UseId[] = { &UseId, Id };
34   | 
35   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
36   | /** 				      HEADERS				     **/
37   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
38   | 
39   | #include "modules_def.h"
40   | 
41   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
42   | /** 				  LOCAL DATATYPES			     **/
43   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
44   | 
45   | /** not applicable **/
46   | 
47   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
48   | /** 				     CONSTANTS				     **/
49   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
50   | 
51   | /** not applicable **/
52   | 
53   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
54   | /**				      MACROS				     **/
55   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
56   | 
57   | /** not applicable **/
58   | 
59   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
60   | /** 				    LOCAL DATA				     **/
61   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
62   | 
63   | static	char	module_name[] = __FILE__;
64   | 
65   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
66   | /**				    PROTOTYPES				     **/
67   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
68   | 
69   | /** not applicable **/
70   | 
71   | 
72   | /*++++
73   |  ** ** Function-Header ***************************************************** **
74   |  ** 									     **
75   |  **   Function:		cmdModuleInfo					     **
76   |  ** 									     **
77   |  **   Description:	Callback function for 'module-info'		     **
78   |  ** 									     **
79   |  **   First Edition:	1991/10/23					     **
80   |  ** 									     **
81   |  **   Parameters:	ClientData	 client_data			     **
82   |  **			Tcl_Interp	*interp		According Tcl interp.**
83   |  **			int		 objc		Number of arguments  **
84   |  **			Tcl_Obj		*objv[]		Argument array	     **
85   |  ** 									     **
86   |  **   Result:		int	TCL_OK		Successful completion	     **
87   |  **				TCL_ERROR	Any error		     **
88   |  ** 									     **
89   |  **   Attached Globals:	g_flags			These are set up accordingly **
90   |  **						before this function is	     **
91   |  **						called in order to control   **
92   |  **						everything.		     **
93   |  **			g_specified_module	The module name from the     **
94   |  **						command line.		     **
95   |  **			g_current_module	The module which is handled  **
96   |  **						by the current command	     **
97   |  ** 									     **
98   |  ** ************************************************************************ **
99   |  ++++*/
100  | 
101  | int cmdModuleInfo(
102  | 	ClientData client_data,
103  | 	Tcl_Interp * interp,
104  | 	int objc,
105  | 	Tcl_Obj * CONST84 objv[]
106  | ) {
107  | 	char           *arg0, *arg1, *arg2;
108  | 	char           *s, *t, buf[BUFSIZ];
109  | 
110  |     /**
111  |      **  Parameter check
112  |      **/
113  | 	arg0 = Tcl_GetString(objv[0]);
114  | 	if (objc < 2) {
115  | 		if (OK != ErrorLogger(ERR_USAGE, LOC, arg0, "info-descriptor ",
116  | 				      "descriptor-args", NULL))
117  | 			return (TCL_ERROR);	/** ---- EXIT (FAILURE) ---> **/
118  | 	}
119  |     /**
120  |      **  'module-info flags' ?
121  |      **/
122  | 	arg1 = Tcl_GetString(objv[1]);
123  | 	if (objc > 2)
124  | 		arg2 = Tcl_GetString(objv[2]);
125  | 	if (!strcmp(arg1, "flags")) {
126  | 		char            tmpbuf[6];
127  | 		sprintf(tmpbuf, "%d", g_flags);
128  | 		Tcl_SetResult(interp, tmpbuf, TCL_VOLATILE);
129  |     /**
130  |      **  'module-info mode'
131  |      **  without suggestion this will return the name of the state we're in.
132  |      **/
133  | 	} else if (!strcmp(arg1, "mode")) {
134  | 
135  | 		if (objc < 3) {
136  | 			if (g_flags & M_SWSTATE1)
137  | 				Tcl_SetResult(interp, "switch1", TCL_STATIC);
138  | 			else if (g_flags & M_SWSTATE2)
139  | 				Tcl_SetResult(interp, "switch2", TCL_STATIC);
140  | 			else if (g_flags & M_SWSTATE3)
141  | 				Tcl_SetResult(interp, "switch3", TCL_STATIC);
142  | 			else if (g_flags & M_LOAD)
143  | 				Tcl_SetResult(interp, "load", TCL_STATIC);
144  | 			else if (g_flags & M_REMOVE)
145  | 				Tcl_SetResult(interp, "remove", TCL_STATIC);
146  | 			else if (g_flags & M_DISPLAY)
147  | 				Tcl_SetResult(interp, "display", TCL_STATIC);
148  | 			else if (g_flags & M_HELP)
149  | 				Tcl_SetResult(interp, "help", TCL_STATIC);
150  | 			else if (g_flags & M_WHATIS)
151  | 				Tcl_SetResult(interp, "whatis", TCL_STATIC);
152  | 			else if (g_flags & M_NONPERSIST)
153  | 				Tcl_SetResult(interp, "nonpersist", TCL_STATIC);
154  | 			else
155  | 				Tcl_SetResult(interp, "unknown", TCL_STATIC);
156  | 		} else {
157  | 	    /**
158  | 	     **  'module-info mode <my_suggestion>'
159  | 	     **  results in a boolean return indicating whether this is the
160  | 	     **  correct state ...
161  | 	     **/
162  | 			Tcl_SetResult(interp, "0", TCL_STATIC);
163  | 
164  | 			if (!strcmp(arg2, "load")) {
165  | 				if (g_flags & M_LOAD)
166  | 					Tcl_SetResult(interp, "1", TCL_STATIC);
167  | 			} else if (!strcmp(arg2, "remove")) {
168  | 				if (g_flags & M_REMOVE)
169  | 					Tcl_SetResult(interp, "1", TCL_STATIC);
170  | 			} else if (!strcmp(arg2, "display")) {
171  | 				if (g_flags & M_DISPLAY)
172  | 					Tcl_SetResult(interp, "1", TCL_STATIC);
173  | 			} else if (!strcmp(arg2, "nonpersist")) {
174  | 				if (g_flags & M_NONPERSIST)
175  | 					Tcl_SetResult(interp, "1", TCL_STATIC);
176  | 			} else if (!strcmp(arg2, "help")) {
177  | 				if (g_flags & M_HELP)
178  | 					Tcl_SetResult(interp, "1", TCL_STATIC);
179  | 			} else if (!strcmp(arg2, "whatis")) {
180  | 				if (g_flags & M_WHATIS)
181  | 					Tcl_SetResult(interp, "1", TCL_STATIC);
182  | 			} else if (!strcmp(arg2, "switch1")) {
183  | 				if (g_flags & M_SWSTATE1)
184  | 					Tcl_SetResult(interp, "1", TCL_STATIC);
185  | 			} else if (!strcmp(arg2, "switch2")) {
186  | 				if (g_flags & M_SWSTATE2)
187  | 					Tcl_SetResult(interp, "1", TCL_STATIC);
188  | 			} else if (!strcmp(arg2, "switch3")) {
189  | 				if (g_flags & M_SWSTATE3)
190  | 					Tcl_SetResult(interp, "1", TCL_STATIC);
191  | 			} else if (!strcmp(arg2, "switch")) {
192  | 				if (g_flags & M_SWITCH)
193  | 					Tcl_SetResult(interp, "1", TCL_STATIC);
194  | 			} else {
195  | 				ErrorLogger(ERR_USAGE, LOC, arg0, "mode ",
196  | 					    "[load|remove|display|help|whatis|switch1|switch2|switch3|switch|nonpersist]",
197  | 					    NULL);
198  | 				return (TCL_ERROR); /** -- EXIT (FAILURE) -> **/
199  | 			}
200  | 		}
201  |     /**
202  |      **  'module-info user'
203  |      **  without suggestion this will return the current user level
204  |      **/
205  | 	} else if (!strcmp(arg1, "user")) {
206  | 		if (objc < 3) {
207  | 			if (UL_NOVICE == sw_userlvl)
208  | 				Tcl_SetResult(interp, "novice", TCL_STATIC);
209  | 			else if (UL_ADVANCED == sw_userlvl)
210  | 				Tcl_SetResult(interp, "advanced", TCL_STATIC);
211  | 			else if (UL_EXPERT == sw_userlvl)
212  | 				Tcl_SetResult(interp, "expert", TCL_STATIC);
213  | 			else
214  | 				Tcl_SetResult(interp, "unknown", TCL_STATIC);
215  | 		} else {
216  | 	    /**
217  | 	     **  'module-info user <my_suggestion>'
218  | 	     **  results in a boolean return indicating whether this is the
219  | 	     **  correct user level ...
220  | 	     **/
221  | 			Tcl_SetResult(interp, "0", TCL_STATIC);
222  | 
223  | 			if (!strcmp(arg2, "novice")) {
224  | 				if (UL_NOVICE == sw_userlvl)
225  | 					Tcl_SetResult(interp, "1", TCL_STATIC);
226  | 			} else if (!strcmp(arg2, "advanced")) {
227  | 				if (UL_ADVANCED == sw_userlvl)
228  | 					Tcl_SetResult(interp, "1", TCL_STATIC);
229  | 			} else if (!strcmp(arg2, "expert")) {
230  | 				if (UL_EXPERT == sw_userlvl)
231  | 					Tcl_SetResult(interp, "1", TCL_STATIC);
232  | 			} else {
233  | 				ErrorLogger(ERR_USAGE, LOC, arg0, "user ",
234  | 					    "[novice|advanced|expert]", NULL);
235  | 				return (TCL_ERROR); /** -- EXIT (FAILURE) -> **/
236  | 			}
237  | 		}
238  |     /**
239  |      **  'module-info name'
240  |      **  returns the name of the current module
241  |      **/
242  | 	} else if (!strcmp(arg1, "name")) {
243  | 		Tcl_SetResult(interp, g_current_module, TCL_VOLATILE);
244  |     /**
245  |      **  'module-info shell'
246  |      **  returns the name of the current user shell
247  |      **/
248  | 	} else if (!strcmp(arg1, "shell")) {
249  | 		if (objc < 3) {
250  | 			Tcl_SetResult(interp, shell_name, TCL_VOLATILE);
251  | 		} else {
252  | 			if (!strcmp(arg2, shell_name))
253  | 				Tcl_SetResult(interp, "1", TCL_STATIC);
254  | 			else
255  | 				Tcl_SetResult(interp, "0", TCL_STATIC);
256  | 		}
257  | 	} else if (!strcmp(arg1, "shelltype")) {
258  | 		if (objc < 3) {
259  | 			Tcl_SetResult(interp, shell_derelict, TCL_VOLATILE);
260  | 		} else {
261  | 			if (!strcmp(arg2, shell_derelict))
262  | 				Tcl_SetResult(interp, "1", TCL_STATIC);
263  | 			else
264  | 				Tcl_SetResult(interp, "0", TCL_STATIC);
265  | 		}
266  | 	} else if (!strcmp(arg1, "alias")) {
267  | 		if (objc < 3) {
268  | 			if (OK != ErrorLogger(ERR_USAGE, LOC, arg0, "alias ",
269  | 					      "name", NULL))
270  | 				return (TCL_ERROR); /** -- EXIT (FAILURE) -> **/
271  | 		}
272  | 
273  | 		if (AliasLookup((char *)arg2, &s, &t)) {
274  | 			stringer(buf, BUFSIZ, s, "/", t, NULL);
275  | 			Tcl_SetResult(interp, buf, TCL_VOLATILE);
276  | 		} else {
277  | 			Tcl_SetResult(interp, "*undef*", TCL_STATIC);
278  | 		}
279  |     /**
280  |      **  'module-info symbols'
281  |      **  List all symbolic names of the passed or current module file
282  |      **/
283  | 	} else if (!strcmp(arg1, "symbols")) {
284  | 		char           *name;
285  | 
286  | 		name = (objc < 3) ? g_current_module : (char *)arg2;
287  | 
288  | 		if ((char *)NULL == (s = ExpandVersions(name)))
289  | 			Tcl_SetResult(interp, "*undef*", TCL_STATIC);
290  | 		else
291  | 			Tcl_SetResult(interp, (char *)s, TCL_VOLATILE);
292  |     /**
293  |      **  'module-info version'
294  |      **  Returns the full qualified module name and version of the passed
295  |      **  symbolic version specifier
296  |      **/
297  | 	} else if (!strcmp(arg1, "version")) {
298  | 		if (VersionLookup((char *)arg2, &s, &t)) {
299  | 			if (t) {
300  | 				stringer(buf, BUFSIZ, s, "/", t, NULL);
301  | 			} else {
302  | 				stringer(buf, BUFSIZ, s, NULL);
303  | 			}
304  | 			Tcl_SetResult(interp, buf, TCL_VOLATILE);
305  | 		} else {
306  | 			Tcl_SetResult(interp, "*undef*", TCL_STATIC);
307  | 		}
308  |     /**
309  |      **  'module-info specified'
310  |      **   gives the module name as specified on the command line
311  |      **/
312  | 	} else if (!strcmp(arg1, "specified")) {
313  | 		if (g_specified_module) {
314  | 			/* TCL_STATIC because it comes from the command line */
315  | 			Tcl_SetResult(interp, g_specified_module, TCL_STATIC);
316  | 		} else {
317  | 			Tcl_SetResult(interp, "*undef*", TCL_STATIC);
318  | 		}
319  |     /**
320  |      **  unknown command ....
321  |      **/
322  | 	} else {
323  | 		if (OK != ErrorLogger(ERR_INFO_DESCR, LOC, arg1, NULL))
324  | 			return (TCL_ERROR); /** ------ EXIT (FAILURE) -----> **/
325  | 	}
326  | 
327  | 	return (TCL_OK);
328  | 
329  | } /** End of 'cmdModuleInfo' **/
